properties.address: 16800 N.E. 39th Ct., Redmond
properties.details: Redmond fire crews responded to a fire alarm at an apartment building, where about 100 people were attending a party in a recreation room. There was no fire, but firefighters heard what sounded like a gunshot and called for police, who found Anguiano dead from a gunshot wound to the neck. No arrests have been made.

properties.address: 13700 block of Ambaum Blvd. S., Burien
properties.details: Ortiz was fatally shot during an ongoing argument over defaced gang graffiti. A then-17-year-old, Joshua Rios-Andrade, was charged as an adult with second-degree murder. According to Burien police, Ortiz was a gang member and Rios is an associate or member of a street gang in the greater Burien area.

properties.address: 2200 block of S. Star Lake Rd., Federal Way
properties.details: On the night he was killed, Aber-Williams had been talking to a 23-year-old woman on Snapchat and she asked him to come to her apartment. Her boyfriend, Kevion Alexander, 25, was charged with first-degree murder, accused of ambushing and shooting Aber-Williams in the back of the head to rob him of cash, jewelry and drugs.

properties.address: 8400 block of Rainier Ave. S., Seattle
properties.details: Thomas died from a stab wound to the back that penetrated his heart and aorta. His right eye was also severely burned, likely from a portable propane torch found at the scene. Luke Carlson, 24, was arrested early the next morning outside a restaurant in SeaTac after Carlson's father called 911 to report Thomas' death and told police his son admitted to the killing. Carlson has been charged with second-degree murder.

properties.address: S. 128th St. and 26th Ave. S., SeaTac
properties.details: Trinh was asleep in bed when he was struck in the head by a bullet that came in through his bedroom wall. Deputies found numerous shell casings on the ground outside a neighbor's house and bullet holes in its façade. Bullet holes were also found in a car parked outside the home. No one has been arrested in connection with his death.

properties.address: 2500 block of 244th Ave. S.E., Sammamish
properties.details: Ka'Deidre Rials, now 24, and two teen girls had allegedly broken into several cars and stolen purses and credit cards at Beaver Lake Park in Sammamish. Radcliffe, after seeing his car had been prowled, grabbed a gun from his trunk and began firing at the windshield of Rials' SUV. He was run over and dragged by the vehicle. The King County Medical Examiner ruled Radcliffe's death a homicide. Rials pleaded guilty to felony hit-and-run causing death, plus second-degree identity theft and two counts of second-degree car prowl on Jan. 17. Rials was sentenced Feb. 9 to just under 4 ½ years in prison, with credit for the 377 days she spent in jail.

properties.address: 21600 block of 29th Ave. S., Des Moines
properties.details: King County sheriff's deputies investigating the Jan. 25 death of Moises Radcliffe were outside a Des Moines apartment and preparing a ruse to get a 16-year-old boy to come out and talk to them. The sheriff's office says the boy and Dunlap-Gittens were armed with handguns when they approached the deputies' unmarked police van. The deputies jumped out of the van, ordered the teens to drop their weapons, and say one of them - presumably Dunlap-Gittens - fired at them. Two detectives returned fire, mortally wounding Dunlap-Gittens. The 16-year-old fled but was arrested the next day and was charged with first-degree unlawful possession of a firearm.

properties.address: Third Ave. and Cherry St., Seattle
properties.details: Pitts, who was looking to buy drugs, was gunned down outside a building about 20 minutes after an argument with the occupants of a dark green van. As Pitt was negotiating a drug deal with another person, Seattle police say, Darryl Peterson, wearing a mask, walked up to Pitts, shot him and fled. Peterson, now 37, was pulled over in a traffic stop on Feb. 6 in the dark green van. A Level 3 sex offender who served prison time for rape, he was charged with first-degree murder and first-degree unlawful possession of a firearm.

properties.address: 1200 block of S. 336th St., Federal Way
properties.details: Ana Fevaleaki, now 34, has been charged with second-degree murder, accused of causing fatal head and abdominal injuries to her boyfriend's 2-year-old son. Fevaleaki claimed Angelo had fallen off a chair and bumped his head the day before she took him to Harborview Medical Center on Feb. 4, but doctors determined his fatal injury happened within hours of his receiving medical treatment.

properties.address: 23600 block of Pacific Highway S., Kent
properties.details: Plunkett had been drinking at JJ's Bar and Grill when he went outside to smoke. He was found dead from a gunshot to the chest in the driver's seat of his black Mercedes-Benz. A spent .45-caliber shell casing was found near his feet, along with marijuana. According to police, detectives are actively working the case and are awaiting lab results on evidence sent to the State Patrol Crime Lab for analysis.

properties.address: 10200 block of 23rd Ct. S.W., White Center
properties.details: Liam Carter, then 17, was housesitting and invited Spann, his childhood friend, over to stay with him. The homeowner had given Carter a .38-caliber revolver to protect the house, which had previously been burglarized. Carter and Spann were hanging out, smoking marijuana and playing with the gun when they decided to play Russian roulette and Spann was shot. Detectives say Carter, who called 911, stopped CPR on his dying friend to stage the scene to make it look like the gun fell and accidentally discharged. Carter was charged as an adult with first-degree manslaughter.

properties.address: 600 block of W. Gowe St., Kent
properties.details: Someone called 911 and requested police perform a welfare check on Draman, a homeless man who was moaning as he lay curled up by a fence outside a cross-fit center. Draman died at the scene from multiple stab wounds. No arrests have been made.

properties.address: 1700 block of S. 234th St., Des Moines
properties.details: Police say Stokes, armed with a machete, went in and out of a house occupied by another man. About six officers from Des Moines, Tukwila and Kent attempted to get Stokes to drop the weapon, but police say he did not comply with their orders. He was fatally shot by a Kent police officer. The other officers on the scene did not fire.

properties.address: 32600 block of 16th Ct. S.W., Federal Way
properties.details: Ramirez and Dario Martinez Castro, 18, were at a house party when they got into a fight over which man makes more money. Other partygoers broke up the fight and the two young men shook hands. Martinez, who lived nearby, left the party and returned a short time later with a handgun. Police say he stood in the front doorway and fired six times at Ramirez. Martinez, who fled before turning himself in to police, was charged with first-degree murder.

properties.address: 10300 block of 113th Ct. N.E., Kirkland
properties.details: A relative discovered the body of David Swanson, 62, in the garage of his Kirkland home on April 16 and called police. Officers found his wife, Estelle Swanson, 66, dead in the kitchen. The King County Medical Examiner estimated the couple had died a week earlier, on April 9. Estelle Swanson died from multiple sharp-force injuries and David Swanson from a self-inflicted injury to his neck. The case was investigated as a murder-suicide.

properties.address: 2100 block of S.W. Sunset Blvd., Renton
properties.details: Lubben, who also used the alias Makaiel Blackwell, was found with a gunshot wound to the head in a stairwell of the Sunset View Apartments hours after he had been killed. No arrests have been made.

properties.address: Pacific Highway S. & Dash Point Rd., Federal Way
properties.details: Police say three people stalked Alvarez for blocks and then fatally shot him as he stepped off a Metro bus in a daytime killing that was part of an ongoing Hispanic gang war in South Seattle and South King County. Miguel Bejar, 22, and Antonio Inda, now 16, have both been charged with second-degree murder. A King County Superior Court judge ruled Jan. 31 that Inda, who was 15 at the time of the shooting, will be prosecuted as an adult. Police also arrested Alondra "Mama Pepa" Garcia Garcia, 20, who allegedly drove Bejar and Inda to and from the shooting scene. She has been charged with first-degree rendering criminal assistance.

properties.address: 8300 block of Rainier Ave. S., Seattle
properties.details: Seattle police officers heard multiple gunshots, saw several people run from the area and discovered Williams dead in the parking lot of a business. One man was detained and questioned, then released. Officers found a handgun at the scene. No arrests have been made.

properties.address: 1300 block of Ambaum Blvd. S.W., Burien
properties.details: Plata appeared to be waiting for someone at a gas station when two men approached and shot him numerous times. They then fled in a vehicle. According to police sources, Plata was killed in retaliation for the shooting death of Arturo Marcial Alvarez less than nine hours earlier in Federal Way as part of an ongoing war between rival Hispanic street gangs. No one has been arrested.

properties.address: 64th Ave. S. and W. Meeker St., Kent
properties.details: Matamoros and a 16-year-old boy were shot behind a gas station. The 16-year-old was able to make it inside the station's convenience store and ask the clerk to call 911. Matamoros died outside from a gunshot wound to the neck. There have been no arrests.

properties.address: First Ave. & Madison St., Seattle
properties.details: Police were called after Butts and his then-17-year-old sister stole beer and snacks from a 7-Eleven store. As officers tried to take Butts into custody, his sister is accused of throwing a soda bottle at an officer's head and attempting to choke him, enabling Butts to get free. Several officers chased Butts, who shot Officer Elizabeth Kennedy, but her ballistic vest stopped the bullet. She returned fire, Butts fell, but then he shot Officer Hudson Kang in the face. Kennedy and five other officers opened fire and killed Butts. Kang was hospitalized for several days but survived.

properties.address: 18000 block of 108th Ave. S.E., Renton
properties.details: Jimerson, who died from a gunshot to the head, and a male companion, who suffered multiple gunshot wounds, were found inside a car near Fire Station 13. Jimerson and the injured man were shot outside a bar in Kent, then drove themselves to the area where they were found. Jimerson's death is believed to be gang-related. No arrests have been made.

properties.address: 900 block of N.W. Leary Way, Seattle
properties.details: Outen and William Harrell, now 35, had dated for more than four years and lived a transient lifestyle. When a man knocked on the door of the couple's RV to borrow some gas cans, Outen hid a heroin pipe so he wouldn't see it. Harrell then became enraged and accused Outen of stealing his money and drugs, and stabbed her in the chest with a kitchen knife, police say. Harrell is charged with second-degree murder domestic violence.

properties.address: 2300 block of Rainier Ave. S., Seattle
properties.details: Shabazz was inside a vehicle in the parking lot of Borrachini's Bakery in Seattle when she was shot numerous times in what was believed to be a gang-related shooting. A man inside the bakery also suffered a non-life-threatening gunshot wound. No arrests have been made.

properties.address: 9800 block of 16th Ave. S.W., White Center
properties.details: Two women got into a fight in the bathroom at the Taradise Café and the fight spilled out into the street. Little went to talk to one of the women when another man wearing a hoodie walked up to him and shot him in the head. Detectives identified Billy Dawayne Williams, 30, of Albany, Ore., as the gunman; he was charged with first-degree murder and unlawful possession of a firearm. Williams remains at large.

properties.address: 62nd Ave. S.W. and Alki Ave. S.W., Seattle
properties.details: Thomas was attending a gathering at Alki Beach when he was shot numerous times. The suspected shooter fled in a vehicle. No arrests have been made.

properties.address: 17th Pl. S. and Des Moines Memorial Dr., Burien
properties.details: A passerby discovered Ayson's body in a ravine on July 11. A month earlier, his purchase of $8 worth of marijuana had attracted the attention of a King County sheriff's deputy, who witnessed Ayson, a homeless man, buy pot from Malcolm McGee, now 26. The next day, police say, McGee drove Ayson to a dead-end street and shot him multiple times. McGee was arrested Aug. 1 and is charged with second-degree murder.

properties.address: Highway 509 near S. Cloverdale St., Seattle
properties.details: Graham's body was found in a homeless encampment and his death was initially reported as a drug overdose before detectives determined he had been assaulted. According to court records, Graham demanded drugs and money from a homeless woman, then struck her. Two men - Aaron "AJ" Rillera, 44, and Hung Minh "Pete" Pham, 47 - allegedly struck Graham in the head with baseball bats. Rillera was arrested that day and Pham, who has a violent criminal history, was arrested July 10. Both men have been charged with second-degree murder.

properties.address: 10700 block of 14th Ave. S.W., White Center
properties.details: Jackson died from a gunshot wound to her neck after getting into a fight with her former roommate in the parking lot of the Avenue Apartments. Others at the scene held the now-29-year-old woman down until police arrived. Though a judge found probable cause to hold her on investigation of homicide, she was released from jail two days later. According to the King County Sheriff's Office, no criminal charges have been filed and detectives believe the shooting was accidental.

properties.address: 300 block of N.W. 47th St., Seattle
properties.details: Thordarson's brother returned to the home the siblings shared and found her bloody and unresponsive, lying face down on the living-room floor with a knife nearby. A neighbor later told officers Thordarson's nephew, Javen Thordarson, 18, had been seen leaving the house with something in his hand. Javen Thordarson was arrested that night and charged with second-degree murder.

properties.address: 21st St. S.E. and D St. S.E., Auburn
properties.details: A woman called 911 after Obet, who was armed with a knife, walked into her house, demanded money, and then left when she told him to leave. Auburn police say he went to a second house but then ran away and attempted to carjack a female driver. Officer Jeff Nelson fired at Obet, who died at the scene from multiple gunshot wounds.

properties.address: 13600 block of Third Ave. S., Burien
properties.details: Several people called 911 to report a man with a knife, shouting "I am the Creator" and "I am the killer"; he attempted to stab a man, who fired a gun into the ground to stop Le from advancing, according to the King County Sheriff's Office. The sheriff's office said three deputies confronted Le, who refused commands to drop "what they thought was a knife." Two deputies fired Tasers, with one of them hitting Le, but it had no effect. When Le moved toward deputies, Deputy Cesar Molina shot him three times. A pen was found nearby.

properties.address: 6800 block of 62nd Ave. N.E., Seattle
properties.details: Lyles, a pregnant mother of four, called 911 to report a burglary. Seattle police Officers Jason Anderson and Steven McNew responded, but didn't find any evidence of a break-in. Police say Lyles suddenly brandished a knife and attempted to cut one of the officers. Both fired at her, killing her. The police department later determined Anderson and McNew used reasonable force.

properties.address: 500 block of Queen Anne Ave. N., Seattle
properties.details: Pimentel was eating outside a Dick's Drive-In with two friends as a large crowd, many of them talking loudly, was gathered outside the restaurant. Leon Caril II, who was across the street, apparently became annoyed at the crowd and started pitching items at people. Police say he threw a two-liter soda bottle, which rolled toward one of Pimentel's friends, who told Caril, "That's a good way to get your ass kicked." Caril, 38, charged across the street armed with a Bowie knife and stabbed Pimentel three times, according to prosecutors. He was arrested minutes later in a nearby alley. Caril was charged with second-degree murder.

properties.address: 99th Ave. S. and S. 244th Ave., Kent
properties.details: According to Kent police, Joseph-McDade failed to pull over for a traffic stop, then led police on a one-mile pursuit at speeds reaching 60 mph. An officer briefly stopped the vehicle using a Pursuit Intervention Technique (PIT) maneuver, but Joseph-McDade continued driving toward Officer William Davis, who had gotten out of his patrol car to approach the vehicle. Davis fired twice, striking Joseph-McDade both times.

properties.address: Second Ave. W. and W. McGraw Pl., Seattle
properties.details: After attending a wedding in South Lake Union, Cameron Espitia, 31, wanted to go to an after-party but his wife, Jennifer, wanted to go home. The two got into an Uber and were arguing when police say Cameron Espitia pulled out a handgun, shot his wife in the back of the head and had the driver drop him off. Cameron Espitia was arrested a short time later and claimed he'd fallen asleep in some bushes and didn't recall anything after getting into the Uber. He is charged with second-degree murder domestic violence.

properties.address: 2400 block of S. Star Lake Rd., Federal Way
properties.details: Muipu and her boyfriend, Chris Tavita, were playing with a Taser and a .45-caliber handgun when Tavita, 23, pointed what he apparently thought was an unloaded weapon at Muipu's face and pulled the trigger. She died at the scene. Police say Tavita initially got his younger siblings to lie for him, telling detectives Muipu shot herself in the face while spinning the gun around on her finger. His 12-year-old brother later called a detective and explained what happened. Tavita is charged with first-degree manslaughter domestic violence.

properties.address: 3700 block of S. Oregon St., Seattle
properties.details: Curry was killed and another man wounded in a shooting next to Rainier Play Field. Lloyd Hinton, 43, was the alleged driver of a green Ford Expedition used in the shooting committed by an as-yet unidentified gunman. Hinton was charged with second-degree murder and first-degree assault. The gunman has not been arrested.

properties.address: 3700 block of S. Oregon St., Seattle
properties.details: Stewart was a friend of Shamar Curry, 32, who was fatally shot near the Rainier Play Field on July 9. Stewart was part of a group gathered at a memorial for Curry at the shooting scene when someone in a passing car opened fire, killing Stewart. No arrests have been made.

properties.address: 2400 block of of S. 142 Ln., SeaTac
properties.details: A witness told King County sheriff's detectives that Mitchell and Jose Jaimes Luna, also 21, were on a porch talking when Jaimes suddenly pulled out a gun, shot Mitchell and then himself. Both men died from gunshot wounds to the head. The King County Medical Examiner ruled Mitchell's death a homicide and determined Jaimes committed suicide.

properties.address: 4500 block of S. Willow St., Seattle
properties.details: Passengers in two vehicles were exchanging gunfire as they drove through the area at high speed on July 1. Thomas, 20, was a passenger in one of the cars and was shot in the head. She died from her injuries at Harborview Medical Center on Aug. 7. No arrests have been made.

properties.address: 23600 block of 104th Ave. S.E., Kent
properties.details: Nelson's ex-girlfriend called 911 after Nelson showed up at her workplace, a hookah lounge in a Kent strip mall, in violation of a domestic-violence no-contact order. When Kent police arrived, Nelson ran to his vehicle, started the engine and allegedly dragged an officer and police dog in his attempt to get away. Two officers fired at Nelson, killing him at the scene.

properties.address: 850 block of Rainier Ave. S., Seattle
properties.details: Police say Keat and Tramaine Claiborne, now 28, arrived in a car together at a gas station and got into a fight. Claiborne is accused of pulling out a gun and firing twice into Keat's back as Keat tried to run away. Claiborne then stood over Keat and fired at least three more times into his prone body. Claiborne was arrested in a nearby alley and charged with second-degree murder.

properties.address: 11800 block of Renton Ave. S., Skyway
properties.details: King County sheriff's deputies responded to Skyway Park Bowl after several people called 911 to report that two men had been shot in the bowling alley's bar area. Robinson was pronounced dead at the scene and Gantz died a short time later at Harborview Medical Center. No arrests have been made.

properties.address: 12000 block of Aurora Ave. N., Seattle
properties.details: Elder Carceres, now 30, and Luci Lucarelli, 32, are accused of tying Finney up in his motel room, beating him, putting a plastic bag over his head and repeatedly stabbing him, then stealing a large stash of methamphetamines. At the time of his arrest, Carceres was being investigated for arson; earlier in the summer, he had allegedly set fire to a tent Finney was in. Carceres and Lucarelli are both charged with second-degree murder.

properties.address: First Ave. S. & S. Spokane St., Seattle
properties.details: Moss, who lived in a tent in a homeless encampment beneath the West Seattle Bridge, accused Daniel Markishtum, 34, of stealing something from his tent. During their argument, Markishtum - who also appeared to be homeless - fired a shot, striking Moss and grazing the face of a second man who had tried to mediate. Markishtum was arrested a week and a half later in Pioneer Square. Originally charged with second-degree murder, Markishtum pleaded guilty in November to second-degree manslaughter and first-degree unlawful possession of a firearm and was sentenced to nearly four years in prison.

properties.address: 9500 block of S. 207th Pl., Kent
properties.details: Police say Aregay Tesfamariam, 50, attacked his wife, Ferede-Tesema, with a steak knife in the kitchen of their Kent home and their adult son tried to intervene. Ferede-Tesema ran outside, her husband chased her and resumed his attack. Her death was witnessed by her son and a passing mailman. Tesfamariam, who apparently had a long history of domestic violence against his wife, is charged with premeditated first-degree murder.

properties.address: Sixth Ave. S.W. and S.W. Cambridge St., Seattle
properties.details: Lopez, who went by the nickname "Peachy", went to Westcrest Park to sell some marijuana to a couple other teens and was robbed and stabbed to death. Two weeks later, Seattle police arrested Jonatan Islas Martinez, 18; Elizabeth Cabrera Aparicio, 17; and Diego Carballo Oliveros, 16. All three have been charged in adult court with first-degree murder.

properties.address: 17600 block of 38th Ave. S., SeaTac
properties.details: A 35-year-old homeowner told King County sheriff's deputies he heard a noise in the bedroom where his two toddlers were sleeping and went to investigate. Seeing two people attempting to break into his house through a window, the homeowner fired numerous shots, killing Grant, as the second would-be intruder ran away. No criminal charges were filed against the homeowner.

properties.address: 5600 block of Rainier Ave. S., Seattle
properties.details: Morris and Jamal Austin, 21, got into an argument at a South Seattle convenience store, which turned into a fight out on the street. Morris appeared to be winning the fistfight when Austin then pulled out a gun and started shooting, hitting Morris. Austin ran from the scene and Morris collapsed inside a nearby bar. Austin later turned himself in to police in Kent and was charged with second-degree murder.

properties.address: 8100 block of 31st Ave. S.W., Seattle
properties.details: Police say Velasquez's ex-girlfriend, Anna Kasparova, used a ruse to lure Velasquez out of his house, then walked across the street and took cover as Velasquez got into her car to park it. The alleged gunman, Abel Linares Montejo, pulled Velasquez out of the vehicle, shot him several times and ran off. Kasparova, 21, was arrested at her mother's house in Burien the next day. Montejo, 19, was arrested at an Auburn trailer park on Oct. 4. Both are charged with premeditated first-degree murder.

properties.address: 12400 block of Ambaum Blvd. S.W., Burien
properties.details: According to police, Jose Luis Ramirez Inda, 43, was drinking with four other men in the parking lot of an apartment complex when they were joined by Medina. Medina, who was also drunk, made some comments that angered Inda and the two began fighting. Medina tried to leave but Inda kept going after him. The other men tried to stop Inda, who punched Medina, causing him to fall and hit his head on the concrete driveway. Inda is charged with first-degree manslaughter.

properties.address: 18000 block of E. Valley Highway, Kent
properties.details: Lee, accompanied by a 28-year-old man, got into a confrontation with Nguyen and a 46-year-old man outside a Kent karaoke bar. According to Kent police, Lee pulled a gun and held it to his side as he continued yelling, which is when the 46-year-old shot Lee in the head. As Lee fell to the ground and dropped his gun, the 28-year-old picked up the weapon as the 46-year-old fired at him. The 28-year-old returned fire, fatally shooting Nguyen and injuring the 46-year-old, who survived. No charges have been filed and the case remains under investigation.

properties.address: 2900 block of Fourth Ave. S., Seattle
properties.details: During a fight inside a Sodo restaurant, Mai was stabbed in the chest; he died at the scene. A couple days later, the U.S. Marshals Service arrested a 24-year-old Edmonds man on investigation of homicide but he was released from jail pending further investigation. The case is still under review by King County prosecutors.

properties.address: 16000 block of 39th Lane N., SeaTac
properties.details: Shinelle Stills, who had been married to Samuel Stills for 17 years, had moved out of the family's SeaTac home in May and was in the process of getting a divorce. She returned to the house to visit her son and pets when the couple argued and Samuel Stills accused her of having relationships with other men. He is accused of grabbing a handgun, shooting her once in the back, then standing over her and shooting her three or four more times. Samuel Stills then went into his bedroom and shot himself once under the chin. He survived and is charged with first-degree murder domestic violence.

properties.address: 500 block of Auburn Way S., Auburn
properties.details: Prosecutors say friends Austin Glore, 17, and Michael Sample, 20, arranged to meet Pearson outside a Denny's restaurant in Auburn for a drug deal. Glore gave Pearson a backpack containing electronics, jewelry and money in exchange for 300 Xanax pills and 20 Percocet pills. Glore apparently believed he had been ripped off and chased after Pearson. The two fought and Pearson pulled a knife but dropped it after getting punched. Glore is accused of picking up the knife and repeatedly stabbing Pearson. Glore, who was arrested the next day in North Bend, is charged in adult court with second-degree murder. Sample, who allegedly drove Glore from the scene, is charged with second-degree rendering criminal assistance.

properties.address: 23200 block of 105th Ave. S.E., Kent
properties.details: Sweezer's partially burned body was found on the side of the road near Lake Tapps; her vehicle was later found abandoned with a large amount of blood in the trunk. Detectives believe she was killed inside her house in Kent after she apparently surprised Lance Rougeau, now 26, as he burglarized the residence. There, detectives found a dehydrated 4-month-old baby who had been left in her crib. The homicide is being investigated by Pierce County sheriff's detectives because Sweezer's body was discovered in Pierce County. Rougeau was arrested the next day. He is charged in Pierce County Superior Court with first-degree murder and first-degree burglary.

properties.address: 34515 9th Ave S, Federal Way, WA 98003
properties.details: Hawkins, who suffered a gunshot wound to the head, was driven to St. Francis Hospital and dumped from a vehicle, which was later found abandoned outside Federal Way city limits. Police say it's possible she was shot and killed outside the city before being driven to the hospital. No arrests have been made; the investigation is ongoing.

properties.address: 1300 block of N.E. 42nd St., Seattle
properties.details: Officers responded to reports of shots fired in an alley and found two wounded men in a parking lot, where witnesses said there had been a disturbance between a group of people just before the shooting. Fesseha died at Harborview Medical Center from a gunshot wound to the head; a second man in his 20s survived his injuries. No arrests have been made.

properties.address: S. 316th St. and Pacific Highway S., Federal Way
properties.details: Police say Lightfeather was threatening two other men with a gun when someone called 911. Federal Way police responded and two officers fired simultaneously at Lightfeather when he pointed his gun at the officers.

properties.address: Fifth Ave. & Battery St., Seattle
properties.details: Brister and Myles died from multiple gunshot wounds and a second man was injured in an early-morning shooting in Belltown. Seattle police say Jeremy Simmons, 35, apparently targeted Brister because her boyfriend had previously stolen drugs and money from him. The surviving victim told police two men were involved in the shooting. Simmons was arrested Dec. 11 at the California-Mexico border and is charged with two counts of first-degree murder and one count of first-degree assault. His suspected accomplice has not been arrested.

properties.address: 22200 block of 84th Ave. S., Kent
properties.details: Stonney Rivers, 50, is accused of shooting Cabrera in the face during a drug robbery at a Kent motel. Theneious Swafford, 47, is accused of driving Rivers to and from the motel. Days later, both suspects were booked into jail on unrelated warrants. Rivers, who was released from prison in 2015 after then-Gov. Christine Gregoire commuted his life sentence, and Swafford are both charged with first-degree murder.

properties.address: 37614 44th Ave. S., Auburn (unincorporated King County)
properties.details: A couple days after a 27-year-old man punched his female roommate, Peltier, the woman's ex-boyfriend, came to their house, armed himself with a rifle and confronted the 27-year-old in a bedroom, according to sheriff's detectives. Peltier fired the rifle at the roommate at least once and the 27-year-old fired back, shooting Peltier twice in the chest with a 9-mm handgun. The 27-year-old was arrested hours later in Thurston County; King County prosecutors determined he fatally shot Peltier in self-defense. He pleaded guilty to second-degree unlawful possession of a firearm and fourth-degree assault and was sentenced to one month in jail.

properties.address: 12000 First Ave. S., Burien
properties.details: Crouse, of Maple Valley, and a 17-year-old boy from Newcastle both attended a party in an unoccupied unit at the Alcove Apartments. They stepped out into the hall and a witness reported hearing an argument, followed by gunshots. They apparently opened fire on each other: Crouse died from multiple gunshot wounds and the 17-year-old survived. The case remains under investigation.

properties.address: 15th Ave. S. and S.W. 98th St., White Center
properties.details: Witnesses told sheriff's deputies that Su was talking with a group of men when an argument erupted and one of the men shot Su, who died at the scene from multiple gunshot wounds. No arrests have been made.

properties.address: 2000 block of Kent Des Moines Rd., Des Moines
properties.details: On Nov. 10, a resident of an apartment complex called 911 to request a welfare check after seeing a man covered in blood wandering around the parking lot. Police arrived and summoned medics, who took Day to Harborview Medical Center, where he died from a gunshot wound to the head five days later. Malik Tupac Lee, 20, was charged in December with second-degree murder and first-degree unlawful possession of a firearm.

properties.address: 24000 block of N.E. 30th Pl., Sammamish
properties.details: Police went to check on Ricardo "Rick" Nicolini, a 58-year-old Seattle dentist, on Nov. 18 after he failed to show up for an appointment. Officers found his body, along with that of his wife, Mary Ellen Nicolini, 65, and their son, 23-year-old Richard Nicolini. Investigators determined that Richard Nicolini shot both of his parents in the head, then turned the gun on himself. The King County Medical Examiner ruled all three died the day before their bodies were found.

properties.address: E. Spruce St. and 24th Ave., Seattle
properties.details: Seattle police responded to a shots-fired call and another 911 call reporting that a man was down. Medics attempted CPR on Shears, but he died at the scene from multiple gunshot wounds. No arrests have been made.

properties.address: First Ave. S. and S.W. 330th St., Federal Way
properties.details: For a week before her death, Zaragoza had told friends she suspected she was being followed by her ex-boyfriend, Erik Guzman Naranjo. On the night she was killed, she and a male friend drove to a smoke shop, where Zaragoza was shot in the head after Naranjo allegedly busted the driver's side window of her car with the butt of a gun. Her friend fled and was not hurt. Naranjo, 22, was arrested two days later in Lake Oswego, Ore. and charged with first-degree murder domestic violence.

properties.address: 13000 block of S.E. 261st Pl., Kent
properties.details: Prosecutors say Hector Galeano — who had been released weeks earlier from a juvenile rehabilitation facility for a 2016 shooting in Auburn - arranged through friends to buy $500 worth of marijuana from Mattson. Galeano, 18, got into Mattson's car and as Mattson measured out the pot, he showed Galeano and another friend thousands of dollars he kept in a fabric bag. According to police, Galeano scooped up the cash and pointed a gun at Mattson, then ran back to the car he had arrived in. Mattson chased Galeano, who shot him multiple times. Galeano turned himself in to Kent police hours later and is charged with first-degree murder and first-degree unlawful possession of a firearm.

properties.address: 23600 block of 20th Ave. S., Des Moines
properties.details: Police say Jonathan Scott accompanied a woman to the Newport Apartments to get her 10-month-old child back from the baby's father, who lived there. The woman and Eliysares, who was the child's father's roommate, got into an argument in the parking lot; Scott inserted himself into their dispute, then shot Eliysares in the chest. Scott was arrested two days later in Kent and claimed he shot Eliysares in self-defense, but police say Eliysares was unarmed. Scott is charged with second-degree murder and first-degree unlawful possession of a firearm.

properties.address: 25100 block of 74th Ave. S., Kent
properties.details: Police responded to a shots-fired call and found Bardwell unconscious and unresponsive. Detectives believe Bardwell, who died from multiple gunshot wounds, was targeted as a result of his involvement in criminal and drug-related activity. The case is actively being investigated.

properties.address: 3000 block of S. 208th St., SeaTac
properties.details: D'Andre Glaspy, 24, is accused of torturing and beating his girlfriend's toddler son, Moses. Glaspy called 911 to report the child was unresponsive and Moses died at the scene. An autopsy showed that Moses suffered several broken ribs, a fractured pelvis, a heart rupture and damage to his liver, pancreas and bowels; he also suffered at least six blows to the head and had a number of old injuries, including broken bones and partially-healed ribs. Glaspy is charged with second-degree murder.

properties.address: Rainier Ave. S. & S. Genesee St., Seattle
properties.details: Police say Marhowe Kifle, 24, stalked and ambushed Nejash after spotting him entering a marijuana dispensary. Kifle is accused of following Nejash, who was a passenger in a red Ford Taurus, and firing at least six rounds into the passenger side of the Taurus. The driver of the Taurus drove Nejash to Harborview Medical Center, where he died. Kifle, who was out on bail for a July drive-by shooting, was arrested Jan. 2 in Lynnwood. He is charged with first-degree murder.

properties.address: 6500 block of Sand Point Way N.E., Seattle
properties.details: Seattle police responded to a report of an armed robbery at Northgate Mall, then learned two suspects got into a confrontation with the manager of a North Seattle apartment complex a short time later. A female suspect was taken into custody on Holman Road Northwest but Gray, the male suspect, drove off, leading police on a pursuit that ended in Magnuson Park. Police say Gray fired out his window at officers, then at the park's boat ramp. He got out of his car and was confronted by seven officers, who all fired at Gray when he apparently reached for something in his waistband. Police say a gun was found near his body.

properties.address: Martin Luther King Jr. Way S. & S. Othello St., Seattle
properties.details: Farah, of Federal Way, was a passenger in a vehicle when someone opened fire on the car. He was driven to Harborview Medical Center, where he was pronounced dead. No arrests have been made.

properties.address: 16000 block of Cleveland St., Redmond
properties.details: The bodies of Asminin and his girlfriend, Marina Shamshurina, also 27, were discovered when their apartment manager went to check on the couple because he hadn't seen them in a few days. Asminin died from a gunshot wound to the torso and Shamshurina died from a self-inflicted gunshot wound to the head. The case was investigated as a murder-suicide.

properties.address: 11000 block of N.E. 124th St., Kirkland
properties.details: Kirkland police responded to the Emerson Apartments after neighbors reported hearing screams and possible gunshots. Tade, who was reportedly carrying an assault rifle, was shot by at least one officer and died at the scene from multiple gunshot wounds.

properties.address: 500 block of 16th Ave., Seattle
properties.details: Sharon Griffin, a resident of an assisted-living facility in the Central District, was shot in the head by her 70-year-old husband, Gary Griffin, and died at the scene. Gary Griffin later died at Harborview Medical Center from a self-inflicted gunshot wound. Their deaths were investigated as a murder-suicide.

properties.address: 6300 block of S. 212th St., Kent
properties.details: Ochs, who lived in Port Orchard, was the victim of a brutal assault outside the Hawthorne Suites Hotel on Dec. 15. He suffered severe head trauma and died six days later at Harborview Medical Center from blunt-force injuries to his head and torso. Detectives do not believe this was a random attack and think the suspect is someone known to Ochs. The case remains an active investigation. No arrests have been made.

properties.address: 200 block of F St. S.W., Auburn
properties.details: A 21-year-old woman, a friend of Dearden's, was playing around with her uncle's gun and pointed it at Dearden's head. She pulled the trigger, apparently thinking the 9-mm handgun was unloaded. Police believe the shooting may have been accidental but are still investigating. The woman is not in custody.
